name: Cherry Chocolate Chunk Cookies
author: Pat B.
summary: I created these after a trip up north to Traverse City, Michigan's Cherry Festival. Wonderful with their dried cherries! A big hit wherever I take them!
ingredients: ½ cup butter flavored shortening (such as Crisco®)
1 (12 ounce) bag semi-sweet chocolate chunks (such as SACO®)
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt; set aside
Beat the unsalted butter, butter flavored shortening, white sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth
Add the eggs one at a time; beat in the vanilla extract and almond extract with the last egg
Mix in the flour mixture until just incorporated
Fold in the cherries, walnuts, pecans, and chocolate chunks, mixing just enough to evenly combine
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets
Bake in the preheated oven until browned around the edges, 11 to 13 minutes
Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes; remove cookies to a wire rack to cool completely
